message_1: Suppose a transposition cipher is used where every third letter in the plaintext is moved forward by four positions in the ciphertext. If the plaintext is "MATHEMATICS", what is the corresponding ciphertext?
message_2:
To find the ciphertext, we will apply the transposition cipher rule to the plaintext "MATHEMATICS". We will move every third letter forward by four positions.

M (1) A (2) T (3) H (4) E (5) M (6) A (7) T (8) I (9) C (10) S (11)

Now, we will move the 3rd, 6th, 9th, and so on letters forward by four positions:

M A (T+4) H E (M+4) A T (I+4) C S

M A X H E Q A T M C S

So, the corresponding ciphertext is "MAXHEQATMCS".
